ovdesc.p: This parameter file will be allowed to input only when product SP is being set for a company.

desc.p: This field will accept a Version record that is used to authorise SEC.TRADE as a part of aggregated MT515.
This field will hold the OFS.SOURCE record that will be used for aggregation process.
This field will accept a Version record that is used to authorise SC.SETTLEMENT as a part of aggregated MT545 or MT547.
This field specifies the reason code under which rejection MT509 is to be sent.
At present, only following values will be allowed to input
DSEC Invalid security
DQUA Invalid quantity
DDEA Invalid Deal price
NCRR Invalid Currency
ULNK Invalid Reference
If any value is input in this field then rejection 509 will be sent automatically otherwise 509 will be sent manually for the message specified in AUTO.COMPARE field
Valid SWIFT MT509 reason code
The routine specified in this field will be called during inward processing of messages.
The user routine can be used to check for additional rejections for the message type being processed locally at client site.
Two arguments will be passed to this routine.
1. Inward message record
2. Rejection record which is SP.STATUS record
User routine needs to check for rejections using inward message record and append the rejection code to REASON.CODE field of SP.STATUS record
PGM.FILE record with type 'S'
This field will accept a Version record that is used to authorise SP.RECONCILIATION.
This field will accept a Version record that is used to authorise SP.AGGREGATION.
This field will allow options 513 and 515.
Message type specified here will be checked for rejection during inward message processing.
Rejection MT509 will be sent automatically ( when message type is specified) and manually( when message type is not specified or no REASON.CODE specified)
Associated multi value field with USER.ROUTINE and REASON.CODE
Valid DE.MESSAGE record.
ID will be company.
Up to 12 Alpha numeric characters in length
Holds the list of messages that can be used in product SP.
The following message types are supported
Up to 3 numeric characters in length
Defines the name of the directory used to hold incoming MX xml messages.
The UNIX or NT pathname for the directory can be specified with apos;/apos; separators (Note do not use apos;\apos; in an NT environment).
If no path is specified the system will create a directory at authorisation if it does not exist, otherwise the directory must exist.
validation:
Must be a type 1 or 19 file if an existing directory is defined
Defines the name of the directory used to hold archieved MX xml messages recieved.
The UNIX or NT pathname for the directory can be specified with apos;/apos; separators (Note do not use apos;\apos; in an NT environment).
If no path is specified the system will create a directory at authorisation if it does not exist, otherwise the directory must exist.
validation:
Must be a type 1 or 19 file if an existing directory is defined.
Defines the name of the directory used to store the converted OFSML messages from XML message.
The UNIX or NT pathname for the directory can be specified with apos;/apos; separators (Note do not use apos;\apos; in an NT environment).
If no path is specified the system will create a directory at authorisation if it does not exist, otherwise the directory must exist.
validation
Must be a type 1 or 19 file if an existing directory is defined.
